title: Work
content: i already have one job but next friday i'm going to try for a another. i have suddenly showed an interest in paper recycling. i don't know why maby because i'm sick of being in front of a computer all the time & want to do something with my life. the employer i am with is st.laurence community services. i already maintain their art unlimited site [url=http://www.artunlimited.org.au]www.artunlimited.org.au[/url]. my employer pays me $3.71 an hour it's not much but seeing i work with other disabled people & recieve a disability pension from centrelink. i don't need a lot as i if i earn more than $132.00 a fortnight they start deducting my pension if i go over. i've got my finger crossed for next week. if i get in more money for xmas Rorie

title: Re: Work
content: Wow...how do you survive on ~$132/fortnight???<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Work
content:
I expect he gets $4-500 on his pension. Mine is ~$430, but my income from employment at the moment is over $400. Last fortnight that only brought my payment down to $300, so I still get a good deal out of it.

That sort of income is comfortable to live on, but I have no intention of remaining on welfare for much longer.

I also must agree with the comment made in the last thread you posted. It's not healthy to put that much emphasis on money alone. In my experience, keeping your mind on what you would do with the money, such as an improved standard of living, experiences you'd like to have, or things you'd like to own, will contribute greatly to you acquiring what's needed to achieve it, including money. Thinking about money and figures all the time just messes with your head.

Good to hear things are working to your satisfaction though.

title: Re: Work
content:
At least you guys get money somehow... I'm still waiting them to start paying my ~100 euros (that's ~158 Australian dollars for you) a month ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] ) student money or whatever.

Yes, there could be work, but do I look capable of anything or have time? Afraid not.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Work
content:
Community Services, eh? Good job. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I don't actually work, though I have some freelance jobs I can get money from. Nothing big.

So um, do you still play Keen, Rorie? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Work
content:
How do you people LIVE?!

I get 600 dollars a month USD from pension for my disability and that ain't worth a pile of scrib jelly!

I need at LEAST 1000 USD a month to get an apartment and live comfortably. (As in not starving, electricity and water... and furniture.) That is something that is quite litterally impossible for someone as old as me. (Or under 25 really.) Still that only comes out to 12,000 dollars a year which, puts someone in the "poverty" level in the United States.

I SWEAR cost of living is too high in the US... or at least in this state. (Where income of most jobs does not equal to what it costs to live on one's own.) How much do you all have to make in order to live?

How long is a fortnight anyway? Like, 2 weeks?-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Work
content: Well it helps when you don't have to pay rent or utility bills. $100/month goes toward my Internet bill, and the rest I get to play with for crazy things like building a Commodore 64 laptop (and eating).

title: Re: Work
content:
Well where do you live then? Not by yourself?-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Work
content:
I have a convenient arrangement with my Mum and her boyfriend. I inhabit a large brick shed that's been more or less converted into a flat. There are some minor undesirable things about this setup, but it makes for a good base of operations until I launch myself into something new.

Instead of paying rent, I help out with the business designing marketing materials and maintaining the website (www.ozcarnies.com), and carry out the in-house technical support.

title: Re: Work
content:
Is there no minimum wage law in Australia?

And Gal, it's really only in places like NYC that living is that costly. I'll be getting an apartment in Atlanta this summer and I've found fairly nice 3-bedroom ones for about $1000...split between 4 people that's pretty cheap.[url=http://spatang.com/ck][img]http://spatang.com/ck/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/cosmo][img]http://spatang.com/cosmo/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [url=http://spatang.com/nukem][img]http://www.spatang.com/nukem/bannersm.jpg[/img][/url] [img]http://spatang.com/scrobblersig.php[/img]

title: Re: Work
content:
I take it rent is measured primarily in monthly instalments in the USA? Here it's pretty much weekly.

Then again, I haven't investigated the cost of apartments for anything besides holidays, so for all I know they could be done monthly.

[hr]Xtraverse Is there no minimum wage law in Australia?
[hr]Only when you're officially employed, I expect. Rorie's web-development job sounds like an off-the-books sort of deal.

[hr]CK Guy CS: Is that brick building the same Shedquarters you talked about years ago?
[hr]One and the same. It's seen some crazy times.

title: Re: Work
content:
Actually given that Rorie has a disability, it's probably some government scheme where a company gets a tax break and cheap labour in exchange for getting disabled people out and making a meaningful contribution to society.

And Djaser, why don't you like living on your own? I love being able to do whatever I want whenever I want [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

As for rent yes, it's normally charged weekly, but if you want to pay a whole month's rent in advance then nobody's going to complain. That's what my tenant normally does and I don't mind at all...

(Oh and yes Gal, I believe the term 'fortnight' originated from 'fourteen nights' so yeah, two weeks. And you have a disability??)[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: work
content:
I'm an adult (well, at least > 1[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img] here and I'll be living at home until I finish my study. In the meantime, I get the money from my study financing thingy and my mom pays my study for me. Without taking advantage of what the study financing is intended for. Which means that I get 110 euros a month and my mom says "lol, extra pocket money".

Cool, but I don't understand why I can't help pay for my study.____________
